verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, put forth a riddle, and speak a parable unto the house of Israel;
verses.web: “Son of man, tell a riddle, and speak a parable to the house of Israel;
verses.ct: "Son of man, tell a riddle and speak a parable to the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; A great eagle with great wings, longwinged, full of feathers, which had divers colours, came unto Lebanon, and took the highest branch of the cedar:
verses.web: and say, ‘The Lord LORD says: “A great eagle with great wings and long feathers, full of feathers, which had various colors, came to Lebanon, and took the top of the cedar.
verses.ct: Say to them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: A great eagle came to Lebanon — an eagle with enormous wings and a wide wingspan, covered in feathers of every color. It landed on a cedar tree and snapped off its highest branch.

verses.kjv: He cropped off the top of his young twigs, and carried it into a land of traffick; he set it in a city of merchants.
verses.web: He cropped off the topmost of its young twigs, and carried it to a land of traffic. He planted it in a city of merchants.
verses.ct: It broke off the topmost twig and carried it away to a land of merchants, planting it in a city of traders.

verses.kjv: He took also of the seed of the land, and planted it in a fruitful field; he placed it by great waters, and set it as a willow tree.
verses.web: “ ‘ “He also took some of the seed of the land, and planted it in fruitful soil. He placed it beside many waters. He set it as a willow tree.
verses.ct: Then the eagle took a seed from the land and planted it in rich soil beside abundant water, setting it in the ground like a willow.

verses.kjv: And it grew, and became a spreading vine of low stature, whose branches turned toward him, and the roots thereof were under him: so it became a vine, and brought forth branches, and shot forth sprigs.
verses.web: It grew, and became a spreading vine of low stature, whose branches turned toward him, and its roots were under him. So it became a vine, produced branches, and shot out sprigs.
verses.ct: The seed grew into a spreading vine, low to the ground. Its branches reached toward the eagle, and its roots grew beneath him. So it became a vine that produced branches and sent out new shoots.

verses.kjv: There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers: and, behold, this vine did bend her roots toward him, and shot forth her branches toward him, that he might water it by the furrows of her plantation.
verses.web: “ ‘ “There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers. Behold, this vine bent its roots toward him, and shot out its branches toward him, from the beds of its plantation, that he might water it.
verses.ct: But then a second great eagle appeared — also with enormous wings and thick feathers. And this vine bent its roots toward the second eagle and stretched its branches toward him, hoping he would water it from the garden beds where it was planted.

verses.kjv: It was planted in a good soil by great waters, that it might bring forth branches, and that it might bear fruit, that it might be a goodly vine.
verses.web: It was planted in a good soil by many waters, that it might produce branches, and that it might bear fruit, that it might be a good vine.” ’
verses.ct: Yet the vine had already been planted in good soil beside plenty of water — everything it needed to grow branches, bear fruit, and become a magnificent vine.'

verses.kjv: Say thou, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Shall it prosper? shall he not pull up the roots thereof, and cut off the fruit thereof, that it wither? it shall wither in all the leaves of her spring, even without great power or many people to pluck it up by the roots thereof.
verses.web: “Say, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Will it prosper? Won’t he pull up its roots, and cut off its fruit, that it may wither; that all its fresh springing leaves may wither? It can’t be raised from its roots by a strong arm or many people.
verses.ct: "Now say to them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Will this vine thrive? Won't the first eagle rip out its roots and strip off its fruit so that it withers? Every fresh leaf will shrivel up. It won't take a mighty army or a large force to pull it out by the roots.

verses.kjv: Yea, behold, being planted, shall it prosper? shall it not utterly wither, when the east wind toucheth it? it shall wither in the furrows where it grew.
verses.web: Yes, behold, being planted, will it prosper? Won’t it utterly wither when the east wind touches it? It will wither in the beds where it grew.” ’ ”
verses.ct: Even though it was planted, will it flourish? When the scorching east wind strikes it, won't it wither completely — right there in the garden beds where it grew?'"

verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: Moreover LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to me again:

verses.kjv: Say now to the rebellious house, Know ye not what these things mean? tell them, Behold, the king of Babylon is come to Jerusalem, and hath taken the king thereof, and the princes thereof, and led them with him to Babylon;
verses.web: “Say now to the rebellious house, ‘Don’t you know what these things mean?’ Tell them, ‘Behold, the king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and took its king, and its princes, and brought them to him to Babylon.
verses.ct: "Say to this rebellious people, 'Don't you understand what this parable means?' Tell them: 'The king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, seized its king and its officials, and took them back with him to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And hath taken of the king’s seed, and made a covenant with him, and hath taken an oath of him: he hath also taken the mighty of the land:
verses.web: He took some of the royal offspring, and made a covenant with him. He also brought him under an oath, and took away the mighty of the land;
verses.ct: He chose someone from the royal family and made a covenant with him, putting him under oath. He also carried away the leading men of the land,

verses.kjv: That the kingdom might be base, that it might not lift itself up, but that by keeping of his covenant it might stand.
verses.web: that the kingdom might be brought low, that it might not lift itself up, but that by keeping his covenant it might stand.
verses.ct: so that the kingdom would be kept weak and unable to rise up — surviving only by honoring the covenant.

verses.kjv: But he rebelled against him in sending his ambassadors into Egypt, that they might give him horses and much people. Shall he prosper? shall he escape that doeth such things? or shall he break the covenant, and be delivered?
verses.web: But he rebelled against him in sending his ambassadors into Egypt, that they might give him horses and many people. Will he prosper? Will he who does such things escape? Will he break the covenant, and still escape?
verses.ct: But this king rebelled against Babylon by sending ambassadors to Egypt, asking for horses and a large army. Will he succeed? Can anyone do something like this and get away with it? Can he break a covenant and still escape?

verses.kjv: As I live, saith the Lord GOD, surely in the place where the king dwelleth that made him king, whose oath he despised, and whose covenant he brake, even with him in the midst of Babylon he shall die.
verses.web: “ ‘As I live,’ says the Lord LORD, ‘surely in the place where the king dwells who made him king, whose oath he despised, and whose covenant he broke, even with him in the middle of Babylon he will die.
verses.ct: "'As surely as I live,' declares the Lord GOD, 'he will die in Babylon — in the very land of the king who put him on the throne, whose oath he treated with contempt and whose covenant he shattered.

verses.kjv: Neither shall Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company make for him in the war, by casting up mounts, and building forts, to cut off many persons:
verses.web: Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company won’t help him in the war, when they cast up mounds and build forts, to cut off many persons.
verses.ct: Pharaoh and his mighty army won't be able to help him when war comes — when siege ramps are built and walls are raised to destroy many lives.

verses.kjv: Seeing he despised the oath by breaking the covenant, when, lo, he had given his hand, and hath done all these things, he shall not escape.
verses.web: For he has despised the oath by breaking the covenant; and behold, he had given his hand, and yet has done all these things. He won’t escape.
verses.ct: He treated the oath with contempt and broke the covenant. He shook hands on the deal and then did all these things anyway. He will not escape.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; As I live, surely mine oath that he hath despised, and my covenant that he hath broken, even it will I recompense upon his own head.
verses.web: “Therefore the Lord LORD says: ‘As I live, I will surely bring on his own head my oath that he has despised and my covenant that he has broken.
verses.ct: "'So this is what the Lord GOD says: As surely as I live, I will bring down on his own head the consequences of despising my oath and breaking my covenant.

verses.kjv: And I will spread my net upon him, and he shall be taken in my snare, and I will bring him to Babylon, and will plead with him there for his trespass that he hath trespassed against me.
verses.web: I will spread my net on him, and he will be taken in my snare. I will bring him to Babylon, and will enter into judgment with him there for his trespass that he has trespassed against me.
verses.ct: I will spread my net over him, and he will be caught in my trap. I will bring him to Babylon and judge him there for his unfaithfulness against me.

verses.kjv: And all his fugitives with all his bands shall fall by the sword, and they that remain shall be scattered toward all winds: and ye shall know that I the LORD have spoken it.
verses.web: All his fugitives in all his bands will fall by the sword, and those who remain will be scattered toward every wind. Then you will know that I, LORD, have spoken it.’
verses.ct: His best soldiers will fall by the sword, and whoever survives will be scattered to the four winds. Then you will know that I, the LORD, have spoken.'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; I will also take of the highest branch of the high cedar, and will set it; I will crop off from the top of his young twigs a tender one, and will plant it upon an high mountain and eminent:
verses.web: “The Lord LORD says: ‘I will also take some of the lofty top of the cedar, and will plant it. I will crop off from the topmost of its young twigs a tender one, and I will plant it on a high and lofty mountain.
verses.ct: "This is what the Lord GOD says: 'I myself will take a shoot from the very top of the tall cedar and plant it. I will break off a tender twig from its highest branches and plant it on a towering, majestic mountain.

verses.kjv: In the mountain of the height of Israel will I plant it: and it shall bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a goodly cedar: and under it shall dwell all fowl of every wing; in the shadow of the branches thereof shall they dwell.
verses.web: I will plant it in the mountain of the height of Israel; and it will produce boughs, and bear fruit, and be a good cedar. Birds of every kind will dwell in the shade of its branches.
verses.ct: I will plant it on the high mountain of Israel. It will grow branches, bear fruit, and become a magnificent cedar. Birds of every kind will nest in it, finding shelter in the shade of its branches.

verses.kjv: And all the trees of the field shall know that I the LORD have brought down the high tree, have exalted the low tree, have dried up the green tree, and have made the dry tree to flourish: I the LORD have spoken and have done it.
verses.web: All the trees of the field will know that I, LORD, have brought down the high tree, have exalted the low tree, have dried up the green tree, and have made the dry tree flourish. “ ‘I, LORD, have spoken and have done it.’ ”
verses.ct: Then every tree in the field will know that I, the LORD, bring down the tall tree and raise up the low one. I dry up the green tree and make the withered tree bloom. I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will do it.'"
